channel.title: behaviors on (´_ゝ`) the gooberverse
channel.description: Recent content in behaviors on (´_ゝ`) the gooberverse

item.title: understanding the context of your parents
item.description: many times we can be rash in our judgments. i, like many children, argue with my parents. we have occasional conflicts in our ideas about life. and i have come to understand that the context of their lives are key to reaching an understanding of my own. that is to say, sometimes they just get pissed at me because they need something to be pissed at. other times, i find genuine merit behind my parents' criticisms.

item.title: talking to people
item.description: how do you feel about being at parties with strangers? do you go into it thinking it’s an exciting chance to meet new people? are you anxious about having to answer questions about who you are? every time i’m put in that situation, i wonder why i tend more to anxiety rather than curiosity. was it easier that way at some point in time? …easier for who? it’s quite relatable, actually.
